validationRules.curIconType: Required when cursorType is 'mouse-cursor-icon', must be 'icon-predefine' or 'icon-custom'
validationRules.curPreIcon: Required when curIconType is 'icon-predefine', must be valid CSS cursor name
validationRules.circleStyle: Required when cursorType is 'mouse-follow-circle', must be 'mc-cs1', 'mc-cs2', or 'mc-cs3'
validationRules.crclMixBMode: Valid CSS mix-blend-mode value (difference, exclusion, multiply, etc.)
validationRules.circleZindex: Number string for layering (recommend 9999 for top-most)

warnings: Custom cursors don't work on touch devices (mobile/tablets) - provide fallback experience
mix-blend-mode (style-3) may not work on older browsers (IE, pre-2020 Safari)
Setting cursorEffect to 'mc-body' affects entire page - test thoroughly before deploying
High z-index (9999) needed to appear above all content
mcCursorSymbol: 'none' hides default cursor - ensure custom cursor is visible
Large cursor images (>50px) may feel sluggish on low-end devices
listTagHover selector must match actual HTML elements (case-sensitive class names)
Transition durations <0.1s may feel too fast, >1s too slow (sweet spot: 0.2-0.4s)
Don't use both predefined icon (curPreIcon) and custom image (mcPointerIcon) simultaneously
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set mcCursorSymbol: 'none' when using custom cursor (default pointer shows)
Using cursorEffect: 'mc-body' without testing on all pages (may conflict with specific sections)
Not providing sufficient contrast between cursor and background (visibility issues)
Setting circleZindex too low (cursor appears behind content)
Using text cursor (mouse-follow-text) without listTagHover (text always visible)
Not testing cursor on different background colors (especially with mix-blend modes)
Forgetting to set iconMaxWidth for custom images (huge cursors)
Using complex CSS transforms without sufficient transition duration (jarring animations)
Setting mcClick: true without defining mcClickText or mcClickIcon (no visible click effect)
Not accounting for touch devices (custom cursors invisible on mobile)
bestPractices: Use cursorEffect: 'mc-block' for specific sections to avoid page-wide impact
Set circleZindex: 9999 to ensure cursor appears above all content
Use mcCursorSymbol: 'none' to hide default cursor when showing custom cursor
Keep cursor size 30-60px for optimal visibility without obstruction
Use transition durations 0.2-0.4s for smooth, natural animations
Set circleOpacity: 0.5-0.8 for semi-transparent effect that doesn't block content
Use 'difference' or 'exclusion' blend modes for universal contrast on any background
Test custom cursors on light and dark backgrounds for visibility
Provide click feedback with mcClick: true for interactive sites
Use listTagHover with specific selectors (e.g., 'a, button') for targeted hover effects
Keep pointLeftOffset and pointTopOffset 5-15px for proper cursor positioning
Use responsive sizing (md/sm/xs) for cursor elements
Consider hiding custom cursor on mobile with CSS media queries
Use SVG style (mc-cs2) for lightweight, scalable cursor graphics
Test performance with requestAnimationFrame to ensure 60fps smooth following
accessibilityNotes: Custom cursors may confuse users with disabilities - provide option to disable
Ensure custom cursor doesn't obscure important content or text
Don't rely solely on cursor for interaction feedback (use hover states too)
Consider prefers-reduced-motion to disable custom cursor animations for motion-sensitive users
Provide sufficient size (minimum 30px) for visibility by low-vision users
Use high contrast colors between cursor and background (WCAG AA)
Don't hide default cursor without providing visible custom cursor
Test with keyboard navigation (cursor effects shouldn't interfere)
Provide text alternatives for icon-based cursors (aria-labels)
Consider that screen reader users won't see custom cursor effects
Don't use cursor as primary means of conveying information
Test cursor visibility at 200% zoom level (WCAG 1.4.4)
performanceConsiderations: Use requestAnimationFrame for smooth 60fps cursor following
Avoid complex CSS transforms (multiple rotations, scales, skews) - stick to 1-2 simple transforms
Keep cursor images <10KB for fast loading (use SVG when possible)
Limit cursor to specific sections (mc-block) instead of entire page (mc-body) for better performance
Use CSS transforms over position changes (GPU-accelerated)
Avoid animating expensive properties like box-shadow or filters on cursor
Use will-change: transform on cursor element for rendering optimization
Limit transition durations to 0.1-0.5s (longer = more render cycles)
Test on low-end devices - complex cursors can drop frames on older hardware
Consider disabling custom cursor on mobile to save resources

mc-cs2.visualAppearance: Circle outline with no fill, animated SVG stroke

mc-cs3.visualAppearance: Two concentric circles with blend mode (difference, exclusion, etc.) for creative inversion effects

difference.effect: Inverts colors - white becomes black, black becomes white
difference.bestFor: Universal contrast on any background, creative portfolios

exclusion.effect: Similar to difference but lower contrast, softer inversion

multiply.effect: Darkens content underneath, like layering transparent dark glass

screen.effect: Lightens content underneath, opposite of multiply

overlay.effect: Combination of multiply and screen, increases contrast

scale.description: Enlarges cursor on hover (1 = normal, 1.5 = 150% size)

useCaseTips: Creative Portfolios: Use mc-cs3 with 'difference' blend mode for artistic inversion effect
E-commerce: Use mouse-follow-image with magnifying glass icon on product images
Agencies: Use mc-cs1 solid circle with brand color and opacity for modern feel
Gaming: Use predefined 'crosshair' cursor for precision aiming interfaces
Interactive Sites: Use mouse-follow-text with 'Click Me' label for user guidance

integrationExamples.name: Custom Cursor Toggle Button
integrationExamples.description: Allow users to enable/disable custom cursor
integrationExamples.code:
<!-- HTML Toggle -->
<button id="toggle-cursor">Toggle Custom Cursor</button>

<script>
document.getElementById('toggle-cursor').addEventListener('click', function() {
  document.body.classList.toggle('custom-cursor-disabled');
  localStorage.setItem('customCursorDisabled', document.body.classList.contains('custom-cursor-disabled'));
});

// Apply saved preference on load
if (localStorage.getItem('customCursorDisabled') === 'true') {
  document.body.classList.add('custom-cursor-disabled');
}
</script>

<style>
.custom-cursor-disabled .tp-mouse-cursor {
  display: none !important;
}
.custom-cursor-disabled body {
  cursor: auto !important;
}
</style>
